page.title: 17THE TUP SALES.
page.content: The {tup sales }go on for three days. This year it was wet windy when the class visited them on Friday 19" October, the last day. When we got inside it was noisy. There was a warm smell. The{auctioneer,Stuart Bell,}was always shouting out the price of the tup.The farmers were discussing their tups. They have crooks and wear similar cloths,like green body warmers,checked shirts,brown trousers and green wellingtons and caps. The sheep they are selling are pedigree {Swaledale Rams.}We call them tups.The highest price that has been paid for one is{Â£16,000,}but most of them make a few hundred pounds each.The auction is organized by {Penrith Farmers and Kidds Limited}& is held in the auction mart on Faraday Road. It was once held in the streets. Farmers come from all over Britain.
